strategyDetails:
Shadow Ball is a strong STAB move and hits Toxic-immune targets such as Jirachi and Amoonguss. Toxic cripples common Shadow Ball switch-ins like Bulletproof Kommo-o and Assault Vest Tangrowth and builds up chip damage for Aegislash's teammates to capitalize on. Substitute allows Aegislash to get even more Toxic damage while also reducing the prediction it needs; it can also stop moves like Amonguss's Spore. King's Shield allows Aegislash to switch into its Shield forme and scout Choiced-locked foes like Krookodile and Keldeo so that it can switch into the right teammate if needed. Heavy investment in HP and Special Defense lets Aegislash switch into Pokemon like Salamence and Galarian Slowbro without fearing a 3HKO in Shield forme and cripple or attack them; this investment also stops Amoonguss's Foul Play from breaking its Substitute. 136 Speed EVs are an option to outpace Conkeldurr and everything slower.

This set is a solid fit on semi-stall and balance teams thanks to its ability to heavily wear down Aegislash's typical checks, open up holes for its teammates, and be a solid defensive presence. Specially defensive foes that don't care about Toxic, like Celesteela and Chansey, are incredibly hard for this set to deal with, stopping it from making any progress; that's why powerful wallbreakers such as Buzzwole and Mienshao pair really well with it, and Aegislash can soften up some checks to them like Salamence with Toxic damage. Other offensive Pokemon like Jungle Healing Zarude and Obstagoon don't care what Aegislash can do to them, so sturdier walls like Tangrowth and Kommo-o pair really well with this set. Fairy-types like Primarina and Togekiss give it more security against Fighting-types and cover Aegislash's Dark weakness; Sylveon is a notable partner, giving Aegislash Wish support so that it doesn't rely solely on Leftovers for its recovery. Umbreon is another useful partner, not only providing Wish but also easily spreading Toxic and checking some nuisances for Aegislash like Moltres and Nidoking. Regenerator and a Poison typing make Amoonguss one of the most obnoxious foes against this set, meaning that offensive checks to it like Moltres and Mamoswine are natural partners. Aegislash teams need a secondary check for Tangrowth and Nihilego, as they commonly run Knock Off and can leave Aegislash horribly crippled; Pokemon like Amoonguss can achieve this exact job.

pokemonAbilities.abilityDetails: If Aegislash, changes Forme to Blade before attacks and Shield before King's Shield.

strategyItems.itemDetails: At the end of every turn, holder restores 1/16 of its max HP.

strategyAbilities.abilityDetails: If Aegislash, changes Forme to Blade before attacks and Shield before King's Shield.

strategyFirstMoves.moveDetails: 20% chance to lower the target's Sp. Def by 1.

strategySecondMoves.moveDetails: Badly poisons the target. Poison types can't miss.

strategyThirdMoves.moveDetails: User takes 1/4 its max HP to put in a substitute.

strategyFourthMoves.moveDetails: Protects from damaging attacks. Contact: -1 Atk.
